medical_history.chief_complaint: Diffuse abdominal cramps, constipation, and two episodes of nonbilious vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began gradually 6 hours before presentation, worsening to a peak with some localization in the left lower quadrant and infra-umbilical area. Episodes were not associated with any known precipitating factors and were milder in previous similar episodes noted annually since age 17.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patient underwent appendectomy at age 19 with normal pathological examination. At age 68, exploratory laparotomy showed normal small bowel and colon. Occasional episodes of non-pitting and non-itching swelling of leg and forearm, and three episodes of severe facial swelling that spontaneously resolved. Chronic arthritis treated with over-the-counter analgesics.
medical_history.family_history: Two healthy brothers; one son with similar episodes.
medical_history.social_history: Non-smoker, reported social use of alcohol.
